title: The Distortion of Cardinal Preferences in Voting

pubData.venue: International Workshop on Cooperative Information Agents

description: Introduces distortion and misrepresentation in voting. Let there be $m$ candidates and $n$ voters.
results: Section 2.1: Defines $α$-scoring-protocol, and its special cases Plurality, Borda count, and Veto.
Definition 2: Distortion of a voting rule.
Proposition 1: For $m=2$ and $n=3$, distortion of any voting rule is at least $3/2$.
Proposition 2: The $α$-scoring-protocol has unbounded distortion (even if we fix $m$) if $mα_2 ≥ \sum_{j=1}^m α_j$.
Corollary 1: Borda count and Veto have unbounded distortion, even if we fix $m$.
Section 3.1: Distortion in the weighted setting.
Section 3.2 (without proof): Defines the min-score-max-util problem, and shows that it's NP-complete.
